intro: Championella coreana, commonly known as the Korean championella, is a flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Championella coreana is often found in moist, rocky soils in woodland areas.
